section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations

EBLIDA: the European Bureau of Library, Information and Documentation Associations http://www.eblida.org

goals__remit:
LACA: the Libraries and Archives Copyright Alliance, is a voluntary umbrella committee bringing together the United Kingdom's major professional organisations and experts representing librarians and archivists to advocate a fair and balanced copyright regime. LACA works with government and stakeholders to address the copyright, related rights and licensing issues affecting the ability of library, archive and information services to fully deliver access to knowledge in the digital age.  
 
LACA collaborates with EBLIDA: the European Bureau of Library, Information and Documentation Associations and IFLA: the International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions. 
 
LACA is a voluntary group of experts plus representatives from the following organisations and institutions: 
 
Archives & Records Association (ARA) 
Art Libraries Society (ARLIS) UK & Ireland 
British Film Institute (BFI) 
British and Irish Association of Law Librarians (BIALL) 
British Library 
Chartered Institute of Library and Information Professionals (CILIP) 
HearFirst UK 
International Association of Music Libraries (IAML) UK & Ireland 
Lis-Copyseek online community 
Museum Libraries 
The National Archives 
National Health Service (NHS) Scotland 
National Library of Scotland 
National Library of Wales 
National Records of Scotland 
Research Libraries UK (RLUK) 
Scottish Council on Archives 
Share the Vision 
Society of Chief Librarians (SCL) 
Standing Conference of College, National and University Libraries (SCONUL) 
Universities UK 
Wellcome Trust
